p: Comparison of the 13C chemical shift data for C-2, C-4, C-4a, C-5a, C-9a, C-10a, 1- NCH 3, and 3- NCH 3 observed for 1 with equivalent carbons reported for the pteridine metabolites urochordamine A ( 3) isolated from the ascidian Ciona savignyi [ 14] and asteropterin ( 4) isolated from the sponge Asteropus simplex [ 15] provided convincing evidence that 1 contained a pyrazine moiety, since all carbons apart from C-4a and C-10a were within 3.5 ppm of those reported in 3, while C-2, C-4a, C-5a, and C-10a were within 3.1 ppm of those reported in 4 ( Figure 4).
